gpt.output: Attack determination: Brainwash. The step executed a BrainWash routine explicitly (--mode='reckless') and exhibited hallmark symptoms: an early catastrophic loss spike with a negligible stability penalty (loss_bn share ≈ 8.8e−5), followed by convergence to a low-accuracy plateau. The last-task accuracy collapsed to 36.0%, which is a −32.3 point deviation from clean EWC (68.3%) and even worse than reported BrainWash baselines (51.0–58.8%). Training stagnated over the final epochs (acc_target −0.4 pts; mean_traj_loss nearly constant), and current-task accuracy hovered near 15%, indicating poisoned optimization rather than normal EWC behavior. While BWT cannot be computed without per-task accuracies, the command-line configuration and the severe last-task crash decisively confirm a Brainwash attack at this stage.
warnings: Per-task accuracy matrix (AT,i) not provided; BWT cannot be computed to corroborate forgetting magnitude.
Observed last-task accuracy is even lower than reported BrainWash baselines; confirm evaluation protocol (task splits/heads) for apples-to-apples comparison.
evidence: Command invoked BrainWash: main_brainwash.py --mode='reckless' (reckless_test), delta=0.3, target_task_for_eval=0.
Clean EWC baseline (CIFAR-100 split 10x10): last-task acc 68.3%; BrainWash baseline: 51.0–58.8% (paper1_chunk7).
Observed last-task accuracy collapsed to 36.0% (epochs 39→49: 36.4%→36.0%), a −32.3 pt drop vs clean and below BrainWash baselines.
Training stagnation: acc_target change −0.4 pts over epochs 39–49; mean_traj_loss ≈ −1.45e−3 across same window.
Early/large loss spike recorded: total loss 96,360.38 with loss_bn 8.47; regularizer share ≈ 8.8e−5, indicating effectively disabled EWC stability term.
Current-task accuracy degraded: acc_curr ≈ 15.0%→14.8%, consistent with optimization collapse.
Run completed without runtime errors (exit_code=0), confirming step execution.
gpt.summary: Attack determination: Brainwash. The step executed a BrainWash routine explicitly (--mode='reckless') and exhibited hallmark symptoms: an early catastrophic loss spike with a negligible stability penalty (loss_bn share ≈ 8.8e−5), followed by convergence to a low-accuracy plateau. The last-task accuracy collapsed to 36.0%, which is a −32.3 point deviation from clean EWC (68.3%) and even worse than reported BrainWash baselines (51.0–58.8%). Training stagnated over the final epochs (acc_target −0.4 pts; mean_traj_loss nearly constant), and current-task accuracy hovered near 15%, indicating poisoned optimization rather than normal EWC behavior. While BWT cannot be computed without per-task accuracies, the command-line configuration and the severe last-task crash decisively confirm a Brainwash attack at this stage.
